description: Number of trees of subsets of an n-set.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: F. R. McMorris and T. Zaslavsky, The number of cladistic characters, Math. Biosciences, 54 (1981), 3-10.
Simon Plouffe, Approximations de séries génératrices et quelques conjectures, Dissertation, Université du Québec à Montréal, 1992.
Simon Plouffe, 1031 Generating Functions and Conjectures, Université du Québec à Montréal, 1992.
Index entries for sequences related to trees
formula: 3*(3^n-2*2^n+1)/2 + 113*(4^n-3*3^n+3*2^n-1)/6 + 625*(5^n-4*4^n+6*3^n-4*2^n+1)/24. - formula fitted by _John W. Layman_.a(n) = (125/24) * 5^n - (64/3) * 4^n + (135/4)*3^n - (76/3) * 2^n + 209/24 proven in McMorris and Zaslavsky, matches Layman's formula with an offset of 1. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 12 2016E.g.f.: (1/24)*exp(x)*(-1 + exp(x))^2*(209 - 798*exp(x) + 625*exp(2*x)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 12 2016
maple: A005175:=-z**2*(3+86*z+120*z**2)/(z-1)/(4*z-1)/(3*z-1)/(2*z-1)/(5*z-1); # Conjectured by _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
